BIBREF1.title: The geriatrician: the frontline specialist in the treatment of 26 covid-19 patients -Gemelli against COVID-19 Geriatrics Team

FIGREF0.text: The geriatrician: the frontline specialist in the treatment of covid-19 patients -Gemelli 5 against COVID-19 Geriatrics Team" by Landi et al 2 clearly discuss the topics to be considered to 6 best manage the care of sick elders in COVID-19 outbreaks.7 Multimorbidity, frailty, physical disability and cognitive impairment, alterations of the biological 8 background all may play an additional role at worsening the prognosis and increasing the risk of 9 adverse outcomes more than the mere number of years lived. 10 Whatever the causes, the mortality rate in older patients is remarkably high: in our hospital 11 located in Brescia, in the region of Lombardy (the area with the highest rate of SARS-CoV-2 12 infection and death in Italy), in patients over 80 is 54%, in patients over 85 is 75% and in those 13 with severe to terminal dementia (CDR3 to CDR5) is 100%. 14 The use of cut-points based on chronological age as guidance of clinical decision of treatment may 15 put most of elders at risk for second-class care, but very old patients in COVID-19 pandemic have a 16 negligible survival hope, they are "de facto" a doomed population. 17 A community that abandons their old citizens is a hateful community: if we want to save elderly 18 lives we must absolutely avoid COVID-19 infection. COVID-19 infection for aged person is the 19 "Grim Reaper" and age should therefore be taken into account mainly in order to incentivize an 20 obligation towards prevention.
